topics.body:
Hype pointed me at this thread and I can pretty much confirm his post, except that that one dude actually has more like 40 at this point and not 8. The whole tulpa thing has the potential to be interesting, but the community has done a good job of giving it a . . . bizarre name, and to a degree the group reflected that itself. There was a lot of internal strife over what was appropriate conceptually, and some people put more thought into it than others. It's problematic when anyone can make any sort of claim they want about what's going on in their head without being able to substantiate the meaning of it in any way.

Anyways I liked dragging Hype back in there because he usually shook things up a bit.

Protip: you probably shouldn't make a tulpa at this point.

"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551e1a606368724c19350c00#post_551e1a606368724c19350c00
Git gudder, scrub.

topics.body:
I didn't really think of it as causing problems. Like I said, just shaking things up a bit. They might not have taken the same perspective on it but . . . you understand. :)

And nah, billions-of-tulpas left for some reason citing gossip about his girlfriend. Nobody claimed to know anything about what he was talking about but they both disappeared. It's pretty dead. Somehow he seems to be key to the group achieving more than a page's worth of posts in a day.

No idea what's going on here but it looks amusing so I'll just pretend to laugh

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551e1e366368724a8ded2800#post_551e1e366368724a8ded2800
It's supposedly derived from some old eastern religious stuff. It's basically an imaginary construct that is given a hallucinated form through lots of practice visualizing it. People have taken it a step further in some ways by trying to give tulpas personalities, trying to achieve "conversations" with them, etc. From what I've seen it seems like it is similar, in some ways, to writing a character for a story, in that you have to be intimately familiar with what the tulpa's motivations are so that you know, naturally, how it would respond to a situation.

Supposedly with enough practice it creates what is basically a beefed-up imaginary friend. It seems that only a small portion of the community sees it as an opportunity to implement a sort of mental tool rather than a way to facilitate fantasies, of whatever sort, with their favorite characters, or characters derived from them.

"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551e202b6368724bedb51700#post_551e202b6368724bedb51700

topics.body:
Watching Black Lagoon now, I have no idea what to expect, I did absolutely no prior research

And I'm pleasantly surprised with a solid anime so far

It reminds me of Bebop except... not in space and not in the future

Plus one of the characters has the same voice as Gilda... and acts sorta like Gilda... yet she's a much better Gilda than Gilda
